news.Title: [AI Summary] 采鈺11月營收年減8.42% 股價近一週修正4.81%
news.Content: • 采鈺11月合併營收為7.84億元，年減8.42% [1]。近期股價走勢與此營收數據關聯性不明顯，過去一週股價變動幅度為-4.81%。, • 公司於11月底完成限制員工權利新股收回註銷的實收資本額變更登記 [2]。 【綜合分析】 參考來源：Yahoo奇摩股市: 2則 | 資料期間：2025-11-26 至 2025-12-10 | 新聞數量：2 則 采鈺 (6789) 近期股價面臨修正壓力，最新收盤價為257.00元，較前一日下跌1.53%，近一週股價累積跌幅達4.81%，五日前股價為270.00元。回顧該期間內的新聞資料，采鈺於12月10日公告11月份合併營收為7.84億元，相較去年同期減少了8.42% [1]。此營收數據的下滑，可能為市場近期對股價表現的擔憂之一，儘管近期股價變動與此營收數據的直接關聯性有待進一步觀察。另一則新聞則指出，采鈺已於11月26日完成限制員工權利新股收回註銷的實收資本額變更登記事宜 [2]。此次資本額的變動，係因公司註銷部分員工認購的權利新股，導致實收資本額微幅減少，流通在外股數亦隨之降低，但對每股淨值影響尚待詳細評估。整體而言，儘管面臨營收下滑的挑戰，采鈺在資本結構方面進行了調整，後續營運表現及股價走勢仍需持續關注市場動態與公司營運狀況。

news.Title: [AI Summary] VisEra November Revenue Down 8.42% YoY, Stock Drops 4.81% in Past Week
news.Content: • VisEra's November consolidated revenue was NT$784 million, a year-on-year decrease of 8.42% [1]. Recent stock price movements show no clear correlation with this revenue figure, with a weekly change of -4.81%., • The company completed the registration of changes in its paid-in capital due to the cancellation of restricted stock options for employees at the end of November [2]. [Analysis] Sources: Yahoo Finance Stock: 2 articles | Period: 2025-11-26 to 2025-12-10 | Number of News: 2 VisEra (6789) has recently faced downward pressure on its stock price, with the latest closing price at NT$257.00, down 1.53% from the previous day. Over the past week, the stock has accumulated a decline of 4.81%, compared to NT$270.00 five days prior. Reviewing news from this period, VisEra announced on December 10th that its November consolidated revenue was NT$784 million, an 8.42% decrease compared to the same period last year [1]. This revenue decline may be one of the market's concerns regarding the recent stock performance, although a direct correlation between the stock price movement and this revenue figure requires further observation. Another news item indicated that VisEra completed the registration of changes in its paid-in capital due to the cancellation of restricted stock options for employees on November 26th [2]. This change in capital was due to the company canceling a portion of the stock options subscribed by employees, leading to a slight decrease in paid-in capital and a reduction in outstanding shares. The impact on net asset per share is yet to be fully assessed. Overall, despite facing revenue challenges, VisEra has made adjustments to its capital structure. Future operational performance and stock price trends will require continued monitoring of market dynamics and the company's operational status.
